name: Bangalore
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bangalore (Bengaluru) is the birthplace of the Indian coffee industry - Coffee Board of India was established here, and the city's iconic 'darshini' quick-service restaurants serve filter coffee and dosas to millions of tech workers daily!

hero_dishes.name: Masala Dosa
hero_dishes.description: Crispy fermented rice-lentil crepe filled with spiced potato, served with sambar and chutneys
hero_dishes.origin_story: South Indian staple perfected in Karnataka. Bangalore's dosas are often crispier than elsewhere
hero_dishes.where_to_find: MTR (Mavalli Tiffin Rooms since 1924), Vidyarthi Bhavan (since 1943), CTR

hero_dishes.name: Bisi Bele Bath
hero_dishes.description: Karnataka's signature one-pot meal of rice, lentils, vegetables, and spices, topped with ghee
hero_dishes.origin_story: A royal dish from the Mysore Palace kitchens, now everyday comfort food. 'Bisi bele' means 'hot lentils' in Kannada

hero_dishes.name: Ragi Mudde
hero_dishes.description: Finger millet balls served with spicy meat or vegetable curry
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Karnataka village food - ragi is a superfood that's drought-resistant and nutritious. Eaten by rolling balls and dipping in curry
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Nagarjuna, military hotels (meat restaurants), traditional Karnataka restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Mangalore Buns
hero_dishes.description: Sweet, puffy fried banana bread, served with coconut chutney
hero_dishes.origin_story: From coastal Karnataka, these slightly sweet buns are breakfast favorites
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Brahmin's Coffee Bar, Airlines Hotel, coastal Karnataka restaurants

signature_drinks.name: Filter Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Strong decoction of coffee powder and chicory, mixed with hot milk and served in steel tumbler-dabara
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Poured between tumbler and dabara to cool and froth - the ritual is as important as the taste. Multiple cups daily

signature_drinks.name: Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Bangalore has India's best craft beer scene with numerous brewpubs
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At Toit, Arbor Brewing, Windmills Craftworks - IT crowd fills brewpubs after work

food_culture_notes: Darshini restaurants serve quick, standing-only meals for workers
Military hotels (nothing to do with military) serve non-veg food
IT boom brought global cuisines but traditional food remains king
Thindi Beedi (VV Puram Food Street) is street food paradise
